articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Mugabe successor due back from exile
articles.description: Robert Mugabe's ally turned rival, Emmerson Mnangagwa, is poised to take over as Zimbabwe's president.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Mugabe's downfall: The unanswered questions
articles.description: After a dramatic week in Zimbabwe, questions remain unanswered about Robert Mugabe's downfall.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: US condemns 'ethnic cleansing' of Rohingya
articles.description: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson said Myanmar Rohingya Muslims suffered "horrendous atrocities".

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: US doctor admits to molesting gymnasts
articles.description: The USA Olympics doctor pleads guilty to sex assault charges against women and girls in his care.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: North Korean defector: What we've learned from dramatic footage
articles.description: It seems extraordinary a defector could survive such an escape, but the footage provides rare insight.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Why Russia is sending robotic submarines to the Arctic
articles.description: The harsh icy sea is one of Earth's biggest gas and oil hotspots – and Russia’s sending its military to stake its claim.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: MS-13 gang 'behead man' in Maryland park
articles.description: One man has been arrested and charged over the gruesome gang killing.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: David Cassidy: 'He was my idol'
articles.description: Reacting to the news of the death of David Cassidy, readers share their memories of meeting the 70s star.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Plague reached Europe by Stone Age
articles.description: Plague was present in Europe during the late Stone Age, according to a study of ancient remains.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: US inmate caught after second jail break
articles.description: During his latest escape, Shane Vernon allegedly invaded two homes, stole cars and kidnapped a man.

articles.author: Matthew Boyle
articles.title: Exclusive — Another Alabama Poll: Judge Roy Moore Leads Democrat Jones by Six Points Again
articles.description: A second Alabama special Senate election poll has Judge Roy Moore, the GOP nominee for the U.S. Senate, up six points over radical leftist Democrat Doug Jones ahead of the December 12 election, Breitbart News has learned exclusively.

articles.author: Neil Munro
articles.title: GQ Magazine Urges Readers to Trash Thanksgiving for Trump Voters
articles.description: If you can't argue politics with your relatives, then just trash their Thanksgiving dinner for spite, says a politics column in GW magazine, titled "It's Your Civic Duty to Ruin Thanksgiving by Bringing Up Trump."

articles.author: Ann Coulter
articles.title: Ann Coulter: The History of Sex in America, Part 1
articles.description: Just as every new generation thinks it discovered sex, refusing to wonder how they came kicking and screaming into the world, apparently the new thing is for every generation to think it discovered sexual harassment. There have been tectonic shifts in Americans' attitudes about sex, but the idea of thanking someone by sending him a prostitute with a note in her vagina is of relatively recent vintage.

articles.author: Ian Mason
articles.title: Texas Congressman Joe Barton Apologizes for 'Sexts'
articles.description: Texas Republican Rep. Joe Barton apologized after an anonymous twitter user posted a picture of him naked Wednesday.

articles.author: Pam Key
articles.title: Dem Senator: Gary Cohn Faked a Bad Connection to Get Trump Off the Phone

articles.author: Jack Montgomery
articles.title: Migrant Crisis-Hit Italy Sees Half of Citizens 'Feel Like Strangers in Their Own Country'
articles.description: People across the West increasingly feel like they are "strangers" in their home countries, with Italy leading the pack.

articles.author: John Nolte
articles.title: The New Book Burners: College Students Declare Steve Martin's 'King Tut' Racist
articles.description: Students at Reed College have declared Steve Martin's classic 'King Tut' skit racist and demanded it be removed from the curriculum.

articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.title: Uber Hid Cyberattack That Stole Personal Data of 57 Million People
articles.description: Uber reportedly concealed a cyberattack that saw the personal data of 57 million people stolen by hackers who the company paid off to keep quiet about the incident.

articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.title: Colorado Fines Uber $8.9 Million for Criminal Drivers
articles.description: Colorado's Public Utilities Commission has fined Uber approximately $8.9 million for their employment of drivers with a history of criminal activities.

articles.author: Nate Church
articles.title: Chinese Company Tencent Now Worth More Than Facebook
articles.description: The first Asian company to rise above half a trillion dollars in value is now officially bigger than Mark Zuckerberg's social media behemoth.

articles.author: Julia Horowitz and Danielle Wiener-Bronner
articles.title: Here's what Charlie Rose said about sexual harassment before he was fired for it
articles.description: The host of "CBS This Morning" has been fired by the network following allegations of sexual misconduct.

articles.title: Erica Hill: Staying silent no longer an option - CNN Video
articles.description: HLN's Erica Hill delivers an emotional monologue recalling instances of harassment throughout her career.

articles.author: Brian Stelter
articles.title: CBS' Norah O'Donnell: 'This has to end. This behavior is wrong'
articles.description: How Charlie Rose's co-hosts covered his suspension on "CBS This Morning."

articles.author: Brian Stelter
articles.title: Gayle King says Charlie Rose allegations are 'painful' but necessary for CBS to cover
articles.description: CBS News is very publicly grappling with the sexual misconduct allegations against veteran journalist Charlie Rose.

articles.title: Watch how Charlie Rose covered sexual harassment - CNN Video
articles.description: Charlie Rose has had a long history of discussing sexual harassment on his multiple programs. Now, he has been fired for sexual harassment allegations against him.

articles.author: Tom Kludt
articles.title: Charlie Rose suspended by CBS after 8 women accuse him of sexual harassment
articles.description: Charlie Rose was suspended by CBS on Monday after eight women accused him of sexual harassment, with allegations including groping, unwanted sexual advances and inappropriate phone calls.

articles.author: Jill Filipovic
articles.title: Charlie Rose played the role of dirty older man on  'CBS This Morning'
articles.description: The banter and "sex talk" on display among him and his female co-hosts showed us how our cultural scripts about sex and sexuality allow bad behavior to flourish, and cover for men who abuse their power, Jill Filipovic says.

articles.author: Emanuella Grinberg, CNN
articles.title: American formerly imprisoned in North Korea burns to death
articles.description: Aijalon Gomes, who was freed from North Korea with the help of former US President Jimmy Carter in 2010, burned to death in San Diego, police said.

articles.author: Nicole Chavez and Eric Levenson, CNN
articles.title: Ex-USA Gymnastics doctor pleads guilty to criminal sexual conduct
articles.description: Larry Nassar, the former acclaimed USA Gymnastics team doctor, pleaded guilty Wednesday to seven counts of first-degree criminal sexual conduct and admitted in a Michigan court to using his position to sexually abuse underage girls.

articles.title: Nassar to judge: A match became a forest fire - CNN Video
articles.description: Larry Nassar, the former acclaimed USA Gymnastics team doctor who is accused of sexually assaulting dozens of women and girls, gives a statement before a judge in Lansing, Michigan.

articles.author: Cecilia Kang
articles.title: F.C.C. Announces Plan to Repeal Net Neutrality
articles.description: A rollback of net neutrality regulations would represent a significant victory for broadband and telecom companies like AT&T and Comcast and would amount to a strike against consumers.

articles.author: David Gelles
articles.title: With Net Neutrality and Antitrust Moves, a Mixed Message From Washington
articles.description: Loosening rules on internet providers would let big companies charge more for their services. But a suit to block a merger signals a tougher stance against big business.

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: What is Net Neutrality?
articles.description: The F.C.C. is set to repeal rules that require internet providers to give consumers equal access to all content online. Here's how it works.

articles.author: Ben Protess, Steve Eder and Eric Lipton
articles.title: Trump Organization Will Walk Away From Its Struggling SoHo Hotel in New York
articles.description: A restaurant has closed and room rates have been slashed at the Trump SoHo, which has had trouble attracting guests. The president’s company has negotiated an exit.

articles.author: Nicholas Fandos and Jonathan Martin
articles.title: Joe Barton, Senior Texas Republican, Apologizes for Explicit Photo
articles.description: Mr. Barton, vice chairman of the House Energy and Commerce Committee, was swept into the swirl of sexual improprieties with the posting of an explicit photo.

articles.author: Michael D. Shear
articles.title: Trump Defends Roy Moore, Citing Candidate’s Denial of Allegations
articles.description: President Trump said Alabama voters should not support Doug Jones, the Democratic candidate for the Senate. He declined to say whether he would campaign for Mr. Moore.

articles.author: John Koblin
articles.title: Charlie Rose Fired by CBS After Sexual Harassment Allegations
articles.description: David Rhodes, the president of CBS News, said in an email that allegations of “extremely disturbing and intolerable behavior” had prompted Mr. Rose’s firing.

articles.author: Brooks Barnes
articles.title: John Lasseter, a Pixar Founder, Takes Leave After ‘Missteps’
articles.description: Mr. Lasseter, who is the head of Disney Animation and directed the first two “Toy Story” movies, said he would step away from the company for six months.

articles.author: Maggie Astor
articles.title: 2 Minnesota Lawmakers Accused of Sexual Harassment Step Down
articles.description: Representative Tony Cornish and Senator Dan Schoen announced their resignations amid a national wave of powerful men accused of misconduct.

articles.author: Marlise Simons, Alan Cowell and Barbara Surk
articles.title: Mladic Conviction Closes Dark Chapter in Europe, but New Era of Uncertainty Looms
articles.description: Ratko Mladic received a life sentence for his role in one of the worst atrocities in 20th-century Europe. But nationalist passions are once again on the rise.

articles.author: Harriet Torry
articles.title: Fed on Track for December Rate Rise, but Inflation Worries Persist
articles.description: Federal Reserve officials said at their latest meeting they likely would raise short-term interest rates “in the near term” due to a strengthening economy, although several said their support for the move would hinge on whether they see inflation picking up.

articles.author: Stu Woo
articles.title: Uber Breach and Response Draw Global Government Scrutiny
articles.description: Government officials world-wide said they would look at Uber Technologies Inc.’s handling of a major data breach last year.

articles.author: Jack Nicas
articles.title: Facebook Plans to Let Users Know if They Followed Russian Pages
articles.description: Facebook Inc. on Wednesday said it plans to tell millions of users who liked or followed any of the 290 Facebook and Instagram pages created by Russian actors that they were ensnared in an alleged misinformation campaign around the U.S. presidential election last year.

articles.author: Natalie Andrews
articles.title: Texas Congressman Joe Barton Apologizes After Nude Photo Circulates on Internet
articles.description: Rep. Joe Barton (R., Texas) apologized to his constituents on Wednesday for not using better judgment in his personal life, after a nude photo of him circulated on the internet this week.

articles.author: WSJ Graphics, Image Grid
articles.title: Our Favorite Gadgets: Best Tech Gifts 2017
articles.description: This holiday shopping season, don't just throw money at things because they’re marked down. Instead, buy gifts that retain value. Here are the gadgets we’ve lived with and loved over the past year.

articles.author: Valentina Pop
articles.title: Irish Border Emerges as Roadblock in U.K.’s Brexit Talks
articles.description: Ireland has become an unexpectedly difficult hurdle to advancing stalled Brexit talks, with Dublin warning that Britain isn’t doing enough to prevent the return of a border across the island that could impede commerce and reconciliation efforts.

articles.author: Gabriele Steinhauser
articles.title: Waking Up Alone: How Elite Plotters Toppled Mugabe’s 37-Year Reign
articles.description: Despite mass demonstrations across Zimbabwe, it was the 93-year-old president’s attempted purge of key rivals that sparked a well-coordinated military rebellion, an impeachment move and finally, his resignation.

articles.author: David Benoit
articles.title: Carl Icahn Buys 13% Stake in SandRidge Energy
articles.description: Carl Icahn has purchased at least 13% of SandRidge Energy Inc., joining a list of shareholders who say a deal the oil-and-gas producer struck last week for Bonanza Creek Energy Inc. makes little sense.

articles.author: Robert Lee Hotz
articles.title: New Study Reveals Dark Side of Outdoor Night Lighting
articles.description: Global night light is getting bigger and brighter, blotting out the stars of the Milky Way for one-third of humankind, according to a new study of federal satellite data measuring outdoor lighting.

articles.author: Keach Hagey
articles.title: What Does the AT&T Lawsuit Mean for Fox?
articles.description: As the industry weighs the impact of the Justice Department’s lawsuit, Comcast Corp.’s bid to acquire a significant chunk of 21st Century Fox’s assets draws comparisons to the AT&T-Time Warner deal.
